title: Manager WW Ops BPR - P2P and QTC Programs
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. We are looking for an individual that understands the importance of business architecture and has built leading-edge supply chain solutions using SAP HANA platform/applications.
description: The candidate will be responsible for leading and identifying business process re-engineering opportunities, solutions architecture, and working with partners to implement the solution in SAP. This role requires a deep understanding of core operations throughout the supply chain to manage complex, global initiatives supporting a wide range of initiatives.
preferred_qualifications: Proven track record of leading strategic programs, combined with the ability to implement at tactical project-level activities and tasks. Demonstrated ability to communicate and influence, at multiple levels of cross functional organizations. Led teams and change management strategies in driving process improvement projects. Proficient at leading multiple efforts simultaneously in a global capability including working with international teams. Excellent leadership skills that improve teams efficiency. Motivates team members to produces work product of the highest quality with minimal review by supervisor. Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to adapt one's style based on the level of the audience. Prior consulting experience with Big 4 Consulting Firms is desirable, but not required. Six Sigma and PMP certification is a plus. MBA preferred.
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is between $184,300 and $277,300, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
